result.markdown:
---
title: "nyc restaraurant analysis"
author: "Eddie Eforo"
date: "2023-12-9"
categories: [news]
---




The following statistics and data visualizations are obtained through the data frame "https://bcdanl.github.io/data/DOHMH_NYC_Restaurant_Inspection.csv" and provide information regarding new yokr city restaurants.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
restaurant <- read.csv("https://bcdanl.github.io/data/DOHMH_NYC_Restaurant_Inspection.csv")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.2     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
✔ ggplot2   3.4.3     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.2     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dplyr)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
skimr::skim(restaurant)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
Table: Data summary

|                         |           |
|:------------------------|:----------|
|Name                     |restaurant |
|Number of rows           |17633      |
|Number of columns        |12         |
|_______________________  |           |
|Column type frequency:   |           |
|character                |10         |
|numeric                  |2          |
|________________________ |           |
|Group variables          |None       |


**Variable type: character**

|skim_variable         | n_missing| complete_rate| min| max| empty| n_unique| whitespace|
|:---------------------|---------:|-------------:|---:|---:|-----:|--------:|----------:|
|DBA                   |         0|             1|   1|  75|     0|    13914|          0|
|BORO                  |         0|             1|   5|  13|     0|        5|          0|
|STREET                |         0|             1|   5|  40|     0|     2038|          0|
|CUISINE.DESCRIPTION   |         0|             1|   4|  30|     0|       87|          0|
|INSPECTION.DATE       |         0|             1|  10|  10|     0|      751|          0|
|ACTION                |         0|             1|  33|  47|     0|        2|          0|
|VIOLATION.CODE        |         0|             1|   3|   5|     0|       60|          0|
|VIOLATION.DESCRIPTION |         0|             1|  19| 940|     0|      101|          0|
|CRITICAL.FLAG         |         0|             1|   8|  12|     0|        2|          0|
|GRADE                 |         0|             1|   1|   1|     0|        3|          0|


**Variable type: numeric**

|skim_variable | n_missing| complete_rate|        mean|        sd|       p0|      p25|      p50|      p75|     p100|hist  |
|:-------------|---------:|-------------:|-----------:|---------:|--------:|--------:|--------:|--------:|--------:|:-----|
|CAMIS         |         0|             1| 47112537.51| 4197913.0| 30191841| 41551354| 50049290| 50094455| 50133690|▁▁▃▁▇ |
|SCORE         |         0|             1|       10.44|       5.9|        0|        7|       10|       12|       86|▇▁▁▁▁ |
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
grade_a <- restaurant %>%
  filter(GRADE == "A") %>%
  nrow()
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
print(grade_a)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 16305
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = restaurant, aes(x = SCORE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  facet_wrap(~ `GRADE` )
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](nycQMD_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(restaurant, aes(x = GRADE )) +
  geom_bar() +
  facet_wrap(~ BORO )
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](nycQMD_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
